hints.title: Exponential Convergence (Local)
hints.content:
3959: :label: thm-exponential-convergence-local
3960: 
3961: Assume $\delta > 0$ and that $\rho_0$ satisfies $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) \le \epsilon_0$ for sufficiently small $\epsilon_0$. Then:
3962: 
3963: $$
3964: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty)
3965: $$
3966: 
3967: where:
3968: 
3969: $$
3970: \boxed{\alpha_{\text{net}} = \frac{\delta}{2}}
3971: $$
hints.raw_directive:
3956: **For exact exponential convergence to $\rho_\infty$**: We need $C_{\text{offset}} = 0$, which requires tighter control of the constant terms. This is typically achieved by working in a **local basin** around $\rho_\infty$ where quadratic approximations are valid.
3957:

3964: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty)
3965: $$
3966: 
3967: where:
3968: 
3969: $$
3970: \boxed{\alpha_{\text{net}} = \frac{\delta}{2}}
